question:
With the aid of suitable diagrams, describe the characteristics and mode of formation of any two of the following

(a) Ox-bow lake

(b) Zeugen

(c) Block mountain
answer:
Characteristics and mode of formation of block mountain. Block mountain is formed from faulting and it involves the following:

(i) Two parallel faults develop

(ii) The block enclosed by the two parallel faults remains as it is

(iii) The land on either side of the parallel faults subsides

(iv) The enclosed centre-block, now up standing becomes the horst or block mountain 

(b) Characteristics and mode of formation of Zengen: Zengen is formed as a result of wind abrasion. ​​​​​Zengens are formed in areas in the desert which have a surface layer to hard rock over-lying another layer of soft rock. Before wind abrasion can produce Zengen, fissures or cracks opened by very high temperature on the desert surface must have occurred on the hard surface layer. Wind abrasion then attacks the desert surface through the fissures already existing. The fissures are widened to become furrows while the blocks between the fissures (now furrows) become ridges called "Zengens"

question:
(a) What is soil?

(b) Explain the process of soil formation

(c) Describe a typical soil profile
answer:
(a) Soil is defined as the uppermost layer of the earth crust in which plants get supports and food (or nutrient. 

(b) The process of soil formation is called weathering. Weathering is defined as the breaking down of rocks into tir pieces to form soil

(c) The process of weathering involves three processes:

(i) Physical weathering

(ii) Chemical weathering

(iii) Biological weathering

(i) Physical Weathering: This involves the breaking down of rocks into tin pieces by special agents such as temperature, running water, ice,wind, pressure, etc.

(ii) Chemical Weathering; This involves the breaking down of rocks into tiny pieces by chemical means such as solution, oxidation, carbonation hydrolysis and hydration.

(iii) Biological weathering: Involves the breaking down of rocks by biological agent suc as earthworm, roots of plants, hooves of animals, rodents and the activities of man.

(c) Soil Profile: A vertical section cut across the soil to show the arrangement of layers is called soil profile. The different horizontal layers are called horizons and there are 3 main horizons in a well-weathered soil namely.
A - horizon
B - horizon and
C - horizon.

A Horizon: This is the top soil. It contains remains of plants and anima which have decomposed to form humus, it is also known as the alluvial horizon which is derived by the washing c clay and fine soil particles down the soil profile.

B - Horizon: This is zone of enrichment (alluvial horizon or accumulatic of soil minerals). The minerals have been washed down from the A- horizon and converted into inorganic compound It is regarded as the sub-soil

C - Horizon: This is the layer of underlying weathered debris. It is the source of pares material. It in underlain by hard unweathered rock.

question:
(a) Name four components of the ecosystem

(b) How does the carbon cycle explain the inter-dependence of the components in the ecosystem?
answer:
(a) Four components of the ecosystem are:

(i) Lithosphere (solid-earth crust)

(ii) Hydrosphere (liquid component)

(iii)Atmosphere (gaseous component)

(iv) Biosphere (Living organisms component).

(b) Carbon cycles have helped to explain the inter-dependence of the components in the ecosystem in the following ways.

(i) There is the inter-relationship between plants and the atmosphere as it is from the atmosphere that plan. derive the carbon dioxide that they need for photosynthesis. Then man and other animals give out carbon dioxide through the process of respiration.

(ii) There is an inter-dependence within the biotic components themselves. The herbivores together with the carnivores and decomposers, pass on the energy and matter

(iii) Man also contribute to the carbon in the atmosphere through the burning of fossil fuel, e.g coal, petroleum, liquid gas and burning of wood

question:
(a) Account for the rapid growth of world population in the last two decades

(b) Explain any three problems arising from this rapid growth

(c) Suggest solutions to these problems
answer:
(a) Reasons for rapid-growth of world population in the last two decades are:

(i) Modernization of agriculture leading to plentiful and varied food supply

(ii) Improved health services

(iii) Knowledge of the cause of infectious diseases and how to prevent them

(iv) Better sanitation

(v) Reduced infant mortality rate as a result of better care

(vi) A lowering of the marriage age from 22 to 20 and below

(vii) Change in child bearing pattern as women want to have all their children at once and have a rest later

(viii) Modernization and industrialization make standard of living to improve.

(b) Three problems arising from this rapid growth; 

(i) Problem of housing (accommodation)

(ii) Problem of transportation

(iii) Shortage of food (or starvation)

(c) Solutions to these problems; 

(i) Government and other agencies should establish residential estates

(ii) More roads, railways and other transportation network to take care of the increasing population

(iii) Mechanized agriculture should be practised.

question:
(a) Differentiate clearly between urban settlements and rural settlements

(b) Explain four factors responsible for tl-increase in size of urban settlements

(c) Highlight four problems associated with such growth.
answer:
(a) Urban settlement is a relatively large, dense and permanent settlement of socially heterogeneous individuals usually found in towns, cities or megalopolis while rural settlement is a relatively small and scattered settlement of socially and culturally homogenous individuals found in villages or hamlets.

(b) Four factors responsible for the increase in size of urban settlement include:

(i) Availability of jobs (or employments)

(ii) Presence of social amenities, e.g electricity, water

(iii) Presence of administrative headquarters in urban area

(iv) Involvement of people in commercial and industrial activities in urban areas

(c) Four problems associated with urban growth:

(i) Inadequate transport facilities

(ii) Undue increase in human and vehicular traffic

(iii) Overuse and deterioration of available social services

(iv) increase in the rate of crimes.

question:
(a) Explain, giving examples, four ways in which physical factors may hinder the development of road transportation

(b) Discuss any four factors responsible for the poor network of railways in tropical African countries
answer:
(a) Four ways in which physical factors may hinder the development of road transportation are:

(i) Rugged highlands create pattern for the development of roads

(ii) Climatic factors like rainfall can wash away existing roads or make it more difficult to construct new ones

(iii) Rivers, especially large ones do contribute greatly to the development of roads as huge amount is spent in the construction and erection of bridges

(iv) Swampy area is also a problem as it also takes large amount of money to construct bridges and flyovers across them.

(b) Four factors responsible for the poor network of railways in tropical African countries include:

(i) Capital costs for maintenance and operation of rail transport are usually high

(ii) Lack of spare parts and technical know-how tend to reduce the rail transportation

(iii) Rail lines are constructed only around mineral or agricultural producing areas hence the absence of these products results in low development of rail

(iv) it is relatively too slow and people do not want to travel with it.

question:
(a) Give four reasons why countries engage in world trade 

(b) How have these reasons affected the volume of trade between Nigeria and her neighbouring countries?

(C)(i) Name any two sea routes through which Nigeria trades with the outside world
(ii) Indicate one commodity that Nigeria engages exports through each route
answer:
(a) Four reasons why countries engage in world trade:

(i) Uneven distribution of natural resources, e.g minerals

(ii) Differences in climate resulting in production of different crops in different countries

(iii) The need to generate foreign exchange

(iv) Differences in technical know-how and expertise for the production of mechanised goods a electronics.

(b) (i) Minerals which are not found in Nigeria are imported from neighbouring countries while Nigeria exports her minerals like petroleum to others which do not have it

(ii) Due to differences in climate, some crops which cannot be grown in Nigeria are imported while those that can be grown are exported. But because Nigeria a her neighbours have almost the same climate, the volume of trade tends to be reduced

(iii) There is reduction of t volume of trade between Nigeria and her neighbours because they do not have the technical know-how to produce goods

(iii) Foreign exchange earnings between Nigeria and her neighbours is also very low because they produce almost the same types of goods or products.

(c)(i) Two sea routes through which Nigeria trades with outside wo are:

(a) South Atlantic route and

(b) The Cape route

(c)(ii) The commodity is petroleum (or crude oil)

answer:
(b)(i) Historical factors: These have contributed to the variation in the population density in West Africa because ancient cities that developed like Kano, Katsina, Timbuktu are due to trans-saharan trade which took place several years ago. question:
Give reasons for each of any three of the following:

(a) the importance of fruit farming in the Mediterranean lands

(b) the predominance of lumbering in the Zaire basin

(c) the declining importance of bush fallowing in WestAfrica

(d) the importance of plantation agriculture in EastAfrica.
answer:
(a) Importance of fruit farming in the Mediterranean lands include:

(i) Fruits like oranges, bananas, pineapples are consumed in many homes and are also processed into various forms of juices

(ii) Most of the fruits produced are for export to European market thereby generating foreign exchange

(iii) It also provides employment opportunities to people

(iv) Provides raw materials for canning and processing industries

(v) Wine is obtained from processing of vines which are produced in the Mediterranean lands.

(b) The predominance of lumbering in Zaire basin.

(i) The dense equatorial forest is a source of valuable timber (50%) of Zaire is forested)

(ii) River Zaire and its numerous tributaries provide means of transporting the logs to sawmills or to ports for export

(iii) There is ready market for the sawn timber both internally and externally

(iv) There is high demand for timber as fuel

(c) The importance of plantation agriculture in East Africa

(i) Local people learn new skills in the job as machine operators, seed planters etc

(ii) It provides employment opportunities to the people

(iii) Plantation agriculture helps in bringing about general development in the area where it is practised

question:
(a) Outline any three achievements of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) since its formation

(b) What five problems are facing the ECOWAS in the achievement of its objectives?
answer:
(a) Three achievements of ECOWAS since its formation

(i) There is now free movement of people between the countries as travel visas for visits not lasting more than three months were abolished in 1979

(ii) Border dispute between Benin and Togo was resolved in the spirit of ECOWAS in 1975

(iii) The ECOWAS games held in Lagos in 1977 aided understanding and solidarity among the states

(b) Five problems facing ECOWAS in the achievement of its objectives

(i) The division of West African states along linguistic lines (English and French) discourages the coming together of the two groups.

(ii) Many of the states are unable to pay their annual dues. This makes the running of the secretariat difficult.

(iii) The smaller and poor countries fear that the bigger and richer ones will dominate them economically and politically

(iv) Some of the richer countries are also suspicious that their resources might be tapped to enrich poorer countries

(v) The countries as they become independent adopted their own different currencies. This has complicated trade
